intro: Adenocalymma lineare, commonly known as the linear adenocalymma, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. It produces flowers in shades of pink or white, which attract various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
